This week's Hug Day will focus on '''xkeyboard-config'''! 

After you have triaged or fixed a bug put your '''Launchpad Id''' in the last column and set the row's background to green by adding '''lightgreen''' in the first cell of the column after '''rowbgcolor='''.  This will let people know that the bug in that row has been hugged. 

=== Tools ===

For doing your work easier during the hug days remember to use the <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/UbuntuBugDay/Tools|hugday-tools]]</nowiki>.

=== 5-a-day-ing ===

To sign up for 5-A-Day participation, please add your Launchpad ID to the Participants column. (This is not the email address you used for signing up for LP, but the last part of the URL that https://launchpad.net/people/+me redirects you to (everything behind the ~ sign)):

1. Click on https://launchpad.net/people/+me
2. Look at the URL bar, everything behind the ~ sign is your Launchpad ID. 

Also sign up here: https://launchpad.net/~5-a-day-participants/+join

=== Upstream project ===

The '''xkeyboard-config''' upstream Bug Tracker and Home page are:

* <nowiki>[[https://bugs.freedesktop.org]]</nowiki>
* <nowiki>[[http://www.freedesktop.org/wiki/Software/XKeyboardConfig|XKeyboardConfig in Freedesktop]]</nowiki>

Please check for already bugs filed in the upstream Bug tracker before sending our reports.

=== Meta actions ===

The dealing with these bug reports revealed a usability issue on keyboard layouts that needs to be solved.
The default shortcut to switch between keyboard layouts is Alt+AltGr, and this is a setting that comes from Xorg/xkeyboard-config.
Ubuntu keeps this default in most cases, unless a specific language team selects an alternative layout (they often select Alt+Shift).
The issue is that  
* Alt+AltGr is not publicised in the documents and it is an arcane shortcut.
* Alt+AltGr does not work anymore, and you cannot use it to switch between keyboard layouts. This is an issue with Xorg and it will probably take time to fix, <nowiki>[[https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/462249|462249 ]]</nowiki>

I see two meta actions from this exercise,
* the keyboard indicator should give a hint (make more prominent) the shortcut that helps switch between keyboard layouts. This is probably an Ubuntu UI design request. 
* the Alt+AltGr default shortcut should be changed; we need to get the usability people involved, find something more appropriate (Alt+Shift?) and change it as default throughout.
   Note that Alt+Shift is a bad choice, as it could more easily be used for an application short-cut than the previous one. The trick of using modifiers on both sides of the keyboard was good for avoiding this, could “press both Control keys” (or both shift keys) work? ~~~~
     I use Shift+Shift to switch and it is quite usable without conflicts. (Alt+Shift is said to have an issue with Inkscape). In any case, what is needed is to make this shortcut more prominent, easily shown in the keyboard indicator).
